content.question: Planet <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is a spherical planet of uniform density. Which of the following describes the gravitational field inside Planet <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>?

choices.label: It is zero everywhere inside the planet.
It is a nonzero constant everywhere inside the planet.
It decreases with increasing distance from the planet’s center.
It increases with increasing distance from the planet’s center.

content.answer: It increases with increasing distance from the planet’s center.
